titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Kevin MacDonald papers, 1958-2006, in the Archives of American Art AAA.macdkevi
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Erin Kinhart

note.p: This finding aid is associated with a MARC collection-level record. 360859

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-04-20T10:38-0400

did.abstract: The papers of Washington, D.C. painter and printmaker Kevin MacDonald measure 7.7 linear feet, and date from 1958-2006. The collection contains correspondence with friends and colleagues; journals, notebooks, and other writings; printed material; artwork by MacDonald and others; 29 sketchbooks; and sound, video, and film recordings. Of note are several files regarding his work with the Washington Project for the Arts.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C. research facility. Use of archival audiovisual recordings with no duplicate access copy requires advance notice.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Kevin MacDonald papers, 1958-2006. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The papers of Washington, D.C. painter and printmaker Kevin MacDonald measure 7.7 linear feet, and date from 1958-2006. The collection contains correspondence with friends and colleagues; journals, notebooks, and other writings; printed material; artwork by MacDonald and others; 29 sketchbooks; and sound, video, and film recordings. Of note are several files regarding his work with the Washington Project for the Arts.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged as 8 series.

list.item: Series 2: Notebooks and Journals, 1968-2005 (1.3 linear feet; Boxes 2-4)
Series 4: Project Files, 1958-2005 (1.1 linear feet; Boxes 4-5, 9)
Series 5: Printed Material, circa 1970-2004 (1.0 linear foot; Boxes 5-6, 9)
Series 7: Sketchbooks, circa 1969-2006 (1.1 linear feet; Boxes 6-7, 9)
Series 8: Sound, Video, and Film Recordings, circa 1970s-1990s (0.5 linear feet; Boxes 7-8)

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated in 2012 by Robin Moore, Kevin MacDonald's widow.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Kevin MacDonald papers are owned by the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution. Literary rights as possessed by the donor have been dedicated to public use for research, study, and scholarship. The collection is subject to all copyright laws.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: The collection was processed to a minimal level and a finding aid prepared by Erin Kinhart in 2014-2015. The collection has been minimally rearranged and retains the existing/original folder titles when possible. All materials have been rehoused in archival folders and boxes for long-term stability, but often staples and other fasteners have not been removed. Materials within folders have not been rearranged.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Kevin MacDonald (1946-2006) was a painter and printmaker in Washington, D.C. He received a BFA from George Washington University in 1969, and also took courses at the Corcoran Gallery of Art. From 1967 to 1977 he worked at the Phillips Collection. After leaving the Phillips he worked full-time as an artist, taking an active role in the D.C. arts community. He was co-curator of “The Washington Show” at the Corcoran Gallery of Art in 1986, and served on the Board of Directors for both the Washington Project for the Arts (1986-1992) and Washington Area Lawyers for the Arts (1991-1997). MacDonald regularly exhibited his work at the Lunn Gallery and David Adamson Gallery, and had artist residencies at the Virginia Center for the Creative Arts (1995) and Oglebay Institute (1993). MacDonald also had an interest in music, and served as art director of a short-lived music fanzine called “Infiltrator.” He was in Twisted Teenage Plot, a band organized by fellow artist Michael Clark, and worked with artist and musician Robin Rose on a collaboration called “Scriptronics.” He lived most of his life in Silver Spring, Maryland, a suburb of D.C., and was married to art consultant Robin Moore.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, mostly of a personal nature, is with friends and fellow artists. Included are many handmade holiday and greeting cards, mail art, and illustrated letters. Much of MacDonald's correspondence with friends extends over two decades or more. Of note is correspondence with artists Wilfred Brunner, Michael Clark, Don Cook, Joe Holbach, Susan Kaprov, and Dana Zed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Journals and notebooks contain various writings by Kevin MacDonald. Journals mostly include dated entries containing thoughts on his life and art. Some poetry is also included. Other notebooks contain poetry, travel logs, ideas and sketchs for artwork, and thoughts on art.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Journals are arranged in chronological order followed by titled notebooks. Other notebooks are arranged in rough chronological order at the end of the series.

did.unittitle: Notebook, "Frances and Kevin in New Mexico"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Writings are by Kevin MacDonald and others. MacDonalds writings include many notes on art and philosophy, performance ideas, song lyrics and poetry. Also found are a few draft essays and talks. Writings by others include poetry and creative writing pieces.

did.unittitle: Talk, "Bringing Art Home: Surviving Outside of New York"
"Pictures From Seurat," Poems by Bob Wickless

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here are Kevin MacDonald's files regarding his various projects as a professional artist. Included are files on project ideas, research, proposals, commissions, artist-in-residence, and exhibitions. Of note are his files on the Washington Project for the Arts, for which he served on the Board of Directors, and exhibition files for "The Washington Show," which he co-curated at the Corcoran Gallery of Art.

did.unittitle: Washington Area Lawyers for the Arts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Oversized material housed in Box 9, Folder 2

did.unittitle: Washington Project for the Arts, Botswana
Washington Project for the Arts, Cabaret Re-Voltaire
Oversized, Washington Circle Gallery of Fine Art
Oversized, Washington Project for the Arts, from Box 5, Folder 13

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed material includes exhibition catalogs, announcements, and invitiations, as well as magazines and news clippings about MacDonald and other Washington, D.C. artists. Additionally, there are several zines and photocopied event flyers containing artwork by MacDonald. Also of note is a published booklet about the experimental music and art collaboration between Kevin MacDonald and Robin Rose called "Scriptronics."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Oversized material housed in Box 9, Folder 3

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Oversized material housed in Box 9, Folder 4

did.unittitle: Oversized Magazine, Washington Review, from Box 6, Folder 2
Oversized Zine, Infiltrator, from Box 6, Folder 10

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Artwork by Kevin MacDonald includes drawings and paintings used as preliminary studies for finished works, handmade Christmas cards, collages, "xerox books," and original collages that were used for event flyers. Also found is one paintbrush belonging to MacDonald. Additionally there are collages, art books, and watercolors by other artists including friend Joe Holbach.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Oversized material housed in Box 9, Folder 5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Oversized material housed in Box 9, Folder 6

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Oversized material housed in Box 9, Folder 7

did.unittitle: Oversized Drawings and Paintings, from Box 6, Folder 19
Oversized Artwork by Others, from Box 6, Folder 31

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Twenty-nine sketchbooks belonging to Kevin MacDonald depict preliminary ideas and studies for finished works. Sketches are in pencil, ink, colored pencil, watercolor, and pastel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found here is one videocassette containing two interviews with Kevin MacDonald. Also found are 14 sound cassettes containing music by Kevin MacDonald and others. Of note is a cassette containing recordings of MacDonald's band Twisted Teenage Plot and a live recording of Scriptronics, his experimental music collaboration with artist Robin Rose. Additionally, there are three unidentified Super 8 mm film reels.

did.unittitle: "Dana - I Wish You Could Hear the Piano"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cassette label lists music by Brian Eno and David Byrne, selections from Teenage Jesus and the Jerks and DNA, and four untitled compositions by Michael [illegible] and Dale Scott
